articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus fears affect stock market
articles.description: Coronavirus fears wiped out all of this year’s gains in the stock market. The Dow lost more than 1,000 points today, and the Nasdaq and S&P 500 also tanked. The number of cases of illness here in the U.S. shot up to 53 over the weekend, as dozens of sick pass…

articles.title: Coronavirus case on U.S. base in South Korea
articles.description: In South Korea, a frequent visitor to a U.S. military base has tested positive for coronavirus. South Korea is one of multiple countries where coronavirus infections have skyrocketed. At least 79,000 people have become sick globally. More than 26,000 have die…

articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.title: Coronavirus could cause U.S. drug shortages
articles.description: From A to Z-Packs: Antibiotics and anesthetics especially threatened as up to 90% of their ingredients come from China.
articles.content:
The raging coronavirus outbreak that has shut down employers and paralyzed business in China could soon constrain the production of core ingredients for critical drugs and medical products sold thousands of miles away in the U.S. 
Restrictions on travel to a… [+7213 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Buffett sees economy slowing as coronavirus spreads
articles.description: "This is scary stuff," investor said Monday as stocks fell, but "I don't think it should affect what you do in stocks."
articles.content:
Billionaire investor Warren Buffett says the outbreak of coronavirus disease in China has slowed economic growth and sparked stock market losses in recent sessions, but he remains confident in the long-term future of American business.
Buffett appeared on CN… [+2515 chars]

articles.author: Megan Cerullo
articles.title: Coronavirus has Amazon scrambling to fill inventories, report says
articles.description: Some sellers on the platform are cutting back on online ads to make sure they don't run out of stock, New York Times says.
articles.content:
Apparently not even Amazon — the world's largest online retailer  — is immune to the effects of the rapidly spreading coronavirus disease. 
The contagious disease, officially called COVID-19, has closed factories and slowed the production of everything from … [+2301 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Global stocks plunge as coronavirus fears grow beyond China
articles.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average opened sharply lower Monday as concern grows over the impact of the coronavirus outbreak. Melissa Armo, founder and owner of The Stock Swoosh, joins CBSN with analysis.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Reported cases spike as Europe struggles with its first major outbreak
articles.description: There are over 79,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19 — most of them in mainland China — but Iran, South Korea and Italy have emerged as new hotspots.
articles.content: As reported cases of the coronavirus spiked to over 79,000 over the weekend, Europe struggled to deal with its first major outbreak of the disease, in Italy. South Korea took "unprecedented, powerful" steps to try to contain the spread of the COVID-19, and Ir… [+323 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: More than 600 people infected by coronavirus in South Korea
articles.description: The coronavirus has been spreading fast and cases of the outbreak spiked in South Korea this week. More than 600 people have been infected there. Ramy Inocencio reports.

articles.author: Aimee Picchi
articles.title: Stocks plunge as coronavirus spreads in Europe and Asia
articles.description: The Dow is set to tumble about 700 points amid growing fears about the economic impact of the outbreak.
articles.content: U.S. markets are signaling a steep selloff on Monday as the coronavirus outbreak spreads well beyond China, raising fears about the economic impact of the outbreak on several continents. Authorities in Italy are battling Europe's first major outbreak of the v… [+3131 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus affecting festivities in Italy; South Korea on "red" alert
articles.description: Authorities in Italy announced that all Carnival events had been called off as the region tries to contain the outbreak. In China, more than 2,400 people have died from COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: The coronavirus in China could lead to drug shortages in America
articles.description: The coronavirus is threatening the U.S. medical supply chain as it shuts down factories in China, where many of the core components of drugs sold in the U.S. are made.

articles.title: Multiple countries see sharp spike in coronavirus cases

articles.author: CBS Radio News
articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 02/24
articles.description: A spike in coronavirus cases. Democrats push in South Carolina and beyond. President Trump visits India. Hikers in their 70s rescued after a week. CBS News Correspondent Steve Kathan has today's World News Roundup.
